title: Seminormal ring
summary: In algebra, a seminormal ring is a commutative reduced ring in which, whenever x, y satisfy x 3 = y 2 {\displaystyle x^{3}=y^{2}} , there is s with s 2 = x {\displaystyle s^{2}=x} and s 3 = y {\displaystyle s^{3}=y} . This definition was given by Swan (1980) as a simplification of the original definition of Traverso (1970).
